info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 04 at 8:26AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...HEAVY RAIN SHOWERS WILL IMPACT WEST CENTRAL MECKLENBURG... SOUTHEASTERN GASTON AND NORTH CENTRAL YORK COUNTIES UNTIL 915 AM EDT... At 823 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a series of heavy rain showers approximately 6 miles southeast of Gastonia, or 4 miles south of Cramerton, moving north at 15 mph. Locations to be impacted include... Gastonia, Mt Holly, Belmont, South Gastonia, Dallas, Cramerton, Lowell, Ranlo, Mcadenville and Steele Creek. Heavy rainfall rates of one-half to one inch per hour will be possible in these areas. Deep standing water may develop in low lying areas.
info.instruction: Heavy rainfall may flood areas with poor drainage, such as ditches and underpasses. Avoid these areas and do not cross any flooded roads. Water levels of small streams may also rise rapidly. Seek higher ground if threatened by flood waters.
